front.title: Use cases for DDoS Open Threat Signaling

abstract.t: This document delineates principal and ancillary use cases for DDoS Open Threat Signaling (DOTS), a communications protocol intended to facilitate the programmatic, coordinated mitigation of Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks via a standards-based mechanism. DOTS is purposely designed to support requests for DDoS mitigation services and status updates across inter-organizational administrative boundaries.
